intro: Freycinetia awaiarensis, commonly known as the Awaiares palm, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to the island of Rapa Iti, also known as the Île des Pétrels, in the southern Pacific Ocean. The plant is characterized by its slender, unbranched trunk and pinnate leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of white, silky hairs. It produces small, fragrant yellow flowers that are clustered in branched inflorescences. Freycinetia awaiarensis is considered a rare and endangered species, with limited populations and specific ecological requirements.
